result.execSummary:
The defendant Megale Dates was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
No alcohol or drugs.
No possession, consumption, selling, distributing of illegal drugs or alcohol.
No contact with victims Byron and Nicole S.
Pay all applicable fees of supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a  civil jugment being entered.
AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by State of  Wisconsin DOC. Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens if deemed appropriate.

supervisions.notes: Defendant advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; and he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

Provide DNA sample if one has not previously been provided.  Pay mandatory DNa surcharge, all court costs, fees and surcharges.  
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  25% of prison funds to go toward restitution first, then all other monetary obligations.    Balance during Extended Supervision.
Payment plan to be established for all monetary obligations by DOC.     Failure to pay is entry of civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Megale Dates

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Megale Dates not in court, in custody.  Janet C. Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea hearing scheduled for 05-08-2014 at 01:30 pm.
FILE UNAVAILABLE AT THE TIME OF THIS ENTRY.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Megale Dates not in court, in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of Janet C Protasiewicz.
  Status conference scheduled for 04-01-2014 at 01:30 pm.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 03-27-2014 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Megale Dates in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Megale Dates in custody.  Janet C. Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 22.
Clerk:  jms

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring and Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Megale Dates in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Defendant Megale Dates in custody.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Megale Dates not in court.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 02/05/2014 @ 1:30pm
